posts.post_content:
Posted By: scott brockelman
#1  N173(not an N173 though) sized cabinet of a "Sante Fe" player holding a baseball, on a black mount, very nice image. circa late 1880's early 1890's several tack holes which do not detract. $400

[IMG]http://www.auctionhawk.com/upload/sb1/3414414-DSC00381.JPG[/IMG]

#2 Nice historical 4" x 3" albumen on a 6" x 4" mount of the Lehigh Portland Cement Company Baseball team. The company was founded in 1898 in Allentown,PA. there are 3 players ID on the back all of which appear in the 1900 census for Lehigh county, PA. Dave Ritter, coach and Ray and Robert Bear. Possibly the first company team for the Portland Cement company.  $250

image is much sharper than shown, camera setting a bit bright

[IMG]http://www.auctionhawk.com/upload/sb1/3414411-DSC00382.JPG[/IMG]

[IMG]http://www.auctionhawk.com/upload/sb1/3414412-DSC00384.JPG[/IMG]

scott

Posted By: scott brockelman
It's been over 30 days and thought I'd give these another shot.

Scott
